result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander P Beaton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 4 or any other sentence, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to court costs ($268) and DNA surcharge ($250).  PAID IN FULL.
Maintain employment and/or combinatio of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No contact with the driver or passenger listed in the criminal complaint.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Alexander P Beaton in court, in custody (OTP'd from Milwaukee County Jail), with attorney Theodore Perlick Molinari.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to counts 2 
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 4.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of both counts 2 & 4.
Counts 1, 3 & 5 are dismissed as read-ins.



Court orders the following:
Count 2:
SENTENCE WITHHELD

Term of Probation:  3 Years.
Concurrent to: count 4 or any other sentence.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with: driver or passenger listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge:  $250.
Apply Bail to both counts 2 & 4 and refund balance to posting party.

CONDITION TIME: 
6 Months in the Waukesha County w/huber (all standard release conditions)
Consecutive to the Racine County Case 13CF1037.
Stayed.
To be used at the discretion of the agent.
 
Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.



Count 4:
SENTENCE WITHHELD

Term of Probation:  3 Years.
Concurrent to:  count 2 or any other sentence.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
Same as count 2.

Costs: $268
Apply Bail to both counts 2 & 4 and refund balance to posting party.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.



Defendant to be returned to the Milwaukee County Jail - FORTHWITH.
Received and filed in court.
